title: Apple Maps Now Available on the Web
content:
Apple today announced that it has launched an Apple Maps on the web feature, which is available in a public beta capacity. ‌Apple Maps‌ for the web works in Safari and other web browsers, allowing users to get directions without having to open up the Maps app.


‌Apple Maps‌ on the web works like the ‌Apple Maps‌ app, so users can get driving and walking directions, find places to visit, view ratings and hours, and browse curated Guides.

There are also features for ordering food directly from the Maps place card and discovering places to eat, shop, and explore in cities around the world. Apple says that additional options like Look Around will be introduced in the coming months.
This article, "Apple Maps Now Available on the Web" first appeared on MacRumors.com
